title: Sweeping terms in draft broadcast Bill raise red flags on free speech
selftext:
Expanding its remit from OTT content and digital news to include social media accounts and online video creators; defining a ‚Äúdigital news broadcaster‚Äù in sweeping terms; requiring prior registration with government to prescribing standards for content evaluation, the latest draft of the Broadcasting Services (Regulation) Bill, 2024, raises several questions on the freedom of speech and expression and the government‚Äôs powers to regulate it.
